required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Music on Pain and Satisfaction in Infertile Patients Undergoing Hysterosalpingography
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Music on Pain and Satisfaction in Infertile Patients Undergoing Hysterosalpingography: a Randomized Controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to demonstrate the value of music in infertile patients undergoing hysterosalpingography on patients' level of pain and satisfaction.

primary_outcome.description: pain will be assessed by visual analog scale from 0 to 10

secondary_outcome.description: pain will be assessed by visual analog scale from 0 to 10

arm_group.description: In the music group, music chosen by the participant will be played through a speaker by the nursing staff during outpatient hysteroscopy. Music will be played through a speaker instead of headphones in order to maintain good communication and interaction between the participant and the doctor.
Participants in the non-music group will undergo hysterosalpingography in the same setting and standard procedure without listening to any music.

intervention.description: In the music group, music that chosen by the participant will be played through a speaker by the nursing staff during outpatient hysteroscopy. Music will be played through a speaker instead of headphone in order to maintain a good communication and interaction between the participant and the doctor.
Participants in the non-music group will undergo hysterosalpingography in the same setting and standard procedure without listening to any music.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Infertility; patients aged 19 to 42 years; candidate for hysterosalpingography.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Severe dysmenorrhea; pelvic infections; drug sensitivity; unwillingness to participate in the study; presence of psychiatric disorders, use of psychotropic medications; secondary infertility.

responsible_party.investigator_title: assistant professor of obstetrics and gynecology
